ovdesc.p: This table contains company level default values which will be used when processing new issue transactions.
These defaults will be applicable irrespective of the transaction type and the user must create one record for each company on the system.

desc.p: The transaction code used to signify which type of transaction is being posted, for exchange Profits.
To facilitate the recognition of the transaction code numbers with the application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each application.
The following range has been assigned within T24:
600 - 649 = Securities.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Mandatory Input.
Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
Default transaction code for all Security Debit type entries within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities

Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
Standard T24 numeric field.
Mandatory input.
A maximum of 6 characters may be entered.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the CATEGORY file.
Date by which replies must be received in order for Subscribers to any New Issue to be considered for possible allotment by the Issuing agent concerned.
Standard Date format. Mandatory input.
Standard T24 numeric field.
Mandatory input.
A maximum of 6 characters may be entered.

Standard default to the Nominee Co. indicated. It is unlikely that this facility be utilised but may be necessary where a Nominee Co. is not controlled by the Bank concerned.
Where entered at a Companies' Standard default Level the System will automatically create New Issue Transactions with an inherent Nominee Code relating to the Code as entered here.
1-5 Alpha numeric characters, (type SS) Standard nominee code. Optional input.
Must exist as a valid Nominee Code.

Bank's own account for posting cost and proceeds for any New Issue transaction.
Internal Account or New Issues' Account for default purposes when processing New Issues.
Standard account format. Optional input.
Must exist as a valid Account Number.
Specifies the Company to which the User must be Signed On in order to use the Application.

9 alphanumeric characters 'CCGGGLLLL' where: CC is 2 alpha characters Country Code GGG is 3 numeric characters Company Group LLLL is 4 numeric local code. or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') Company Mnemonic characters. Mandatory input. No Default Value.
Must exist as a valid company code.
Standard default for the delivery of the new issue.
Whenever New Issue Transactions are created by the System they will automatically assume the Delivery Instructions as contained within the Standard Default Tables.
Examples: Receive new issue against payment delivery free of payment.
1-5 Alpha numeric characters, (type S). Mandatory input.
Must exist as a valid Security Delivery Instruction (SC. DEL. Instr) code.
Specifies the category code to be used for the posting of exchange Profit & Loss entries.

This code classifies profit & loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's position.
4 or 5 numeric characters. Mandatory Input.
Must be in range 50-000 to 59-999.
Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code.
